meanings.definition: The act of grabbing or holding onto something firmly.
meanings.sent1: His claughting of the rope saved him from falling.
meanings.sent2: The bear's claughting of the fish was swift and precise.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's claughting of the cookie jar was unsuccessful this time.
meanings.sent4: The claughting of memories flooded back as she visited her childhood home.

meanings.sent6: The claughting of the door handle broke it due to excessive force.
meanings.sent7: The claughting of the pen in his hand showed his determination to write.

meanings.sent10: The claughting of the magnet to the fridge held up the drawing securely.
